image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The man was found guilty last year of unauthorised camping on unleased national land after sleeping in his car in the National Rock Garden carpark near Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.Â

title.children: Judge finds homeless man who slept in his car on national land was parking there not camping

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Federal Court Justice Michael Lee expresses frustration over further delays in the costs battle between journalist Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, telling the court he wants an end to his involvement in it.

title.children: 'I want to bring this to an end': Frustration in court over costs dispute between Ten and Wilkinson

image.altText: An artist's impression showing Europa Clipper nearing Jupiter.

props.synopsis: A team at the Canberra Deep Space Communication Complex is tasked with making "first contact" with NASA's largest and most expensive spacecraft, the Europa Clipper, on its journey to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon.

title.children: Deep space experts tracking NASA mission to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon

image.altText: A green electric vehicle parked in an underground charging bay.

props.synopsis: Strata owners are increasingly banning electric vehicles from charging in basement carparks as fire safety authorities disagree over the risk of battery fires.

title.children: EVs in apartment carparks a battleground amid fight over right to charge

image.altText: Generic AFP Badge

props.synopsis: Senior Australian Federal Police detective Trent Madders will face trial in the ACT Supreme Court next year, facing three charges of aggravated perjury, destroying or concealing evidence, and perverting the course of justice.

title.children: Senior AFP detective to face trial for charges including perjury

image.altText: children play with building bricks

props.synopsis: Three Genius Childcare workers take legal action against the company over allegations it intentionally paid wages late and failed to pay them thousands of dollars in superannuation.

title.children: Childcare chaos as workers sue company

image.altText: A former police officer, a 34-year-old male, arriving at the NSW Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: The former police officer who was found guilty of the manslaughter of 95-year-old Clare Nowland is seeking a review of his sacking in the Industrial Relations Commission.

title.children: Kristian White launches court action after losing police job

image.altText: Andrew Barr throws back his head and laughs as he stands in the middle of a semi-circle of colleagues.

props.synopsis: Compared to Tasmania, the ACT seems to have very few elected representatives. But it's debateable whether that's a fair comparison, and whether something should change.

title.children: There's an argument the ACT should have more politicians, but little support

image.altText: Dozens of tree logs surrounding a large harvesting machine

props.synopsis: The NSW native logging industry is not "economically viable" and the state government should consider shutting it down after 2028 if its prospects do not improve, an independent economic regulator has recommended.

title.children: NSW's native forest logging industry ruled not 'economically viable'

image.altText: Heat makes for restless nights

props.synopsis: Public life ground to a halt, many lost power, and scores of people died behind closed doors. What sounds like the start of a post-apocalyptic movie is in fact Melbourne in January 2009.

title.children: Australia's deadliest natural disaster flew under the radar but killed hundreds

image.altText: Hugh Marks, Nine Entertainment chief executive

props.synopsis: Former Nine Entertainment chief executive Hugh Marks has been appointed as the new managing director of the ABC.

title.children: Former Nine boss Hugh Marks appointed ABC's new managing director

image.altText: Drone pics of the closed Mungar Rd bridge at Tiaro.

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have been submerged by flash flooding overnight, with more rainfall predicted in the next 24 hours.

title.children: Flash flooding hits parts of Queensland as extreme heatwave warning issued

image.altText: A landslide at a wharf

props.synopsis: Authorities say tsunami waves have been observed after a magnitude-7.4 earthquake struck Vanuatu.

title.children: Tsunami waves seen after Vanuatu records magnitude-7.4 earthquake

image.altText: Victoria Police outside Flinders Street Station

props.synopsis: The Victorian government has pledged to introduce a raft of new restrictions on protesters, including banning protests from being held near places of worship.

title.children: Victoria plans protest crackdown in bid to boost social cohesion

image.altText: A collage of pictures of a young boy with brown hair, some with family members.

props.synopsis: Heartbroken relatives are paying tribute to an "inquisitive, car-loving" 10-year-old Victorian boy who died in a car boot during a game of hide-and-seek on Sunday.Â

title.children: Family says 'inquisitive' boy who died in car boot was playing 'hide and seek'

image.altText: Donald trump in a suit with his fist in the air.

props.synopsis: A judge has rejected Donald Trump's bid to have his "hush money" conviction dismissed on the basis of the US Supreme Court's recent ruling on presidential immunity.

title.children: Judge rejects Trump's bid to dismiss Stormy Daniels hush money conviction

image.altText: A woman wearing a black head covering with tears in her eyes

props.synopsis: More than 1 million Syrian refugees poured over the border into Lebanon during the country's horrific civil war, and many are now considering returning.

title.children: Uncertainty for Syrian refugees waiting for safe return after Assad's fall

image.altText: Aboriginal dancer at Currumbin Sanctuary

props.synopsis: The Tourism office is slammed for spending three-quarters of its budget on contractors, with most of those contracts made through closed-door arrangements.

title.children: Tourism Australia spent three-quarters of its budget on contractors

image.altText: Christian Beck holds up the line honours trophy and grins whilst onlookers clap.

props.synopsis: LawConnect skipper Christian Beck says the key to winning line honours of the Sydney to Hobart again will be to let his professional sailors do the work.

title.children: Skipper employs 'do nothing' strategy for Sydney to Hobart

image.altText: Novak Djokovic and Nick Kyrgios pose for a photograph, with their thumbs up and smiling, on a tennis court

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios will team up with Novak Djokovic at the Brisbane International after crediting the former world number one for motivating his return from serious injury.

title.children: Kyrgios announces Djokovic as doubles partner for Brisbane

image.altText: Donald Trump points as he stands in front of a gold-gilded wall and an American flag.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging Q&A with the press in Florida, the president-elect talks about topics ranging from the Middle East to the future of TikTok.

title.children: Five takeaways from Trump's first post-election press conference

image.altText: Aboriginal woman in purple shirt sitting in chair

props.synopsis: When the ABC visited Alpurrurulam, a tiny outback town on the Northern Territory-Queensland border, all anyone in town wanted to talk about was what was happening at the local school.

title.children: Allegations of bullying and inappropriate behaviour at outback school

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Crown Prosecution Service defends the verdicts, saying two juries and three appeal court judges have already "reviewed a multitude of different strands of evidence against Lucy Letby".Â

title.children: Lucy Letby's lawyer wants killer nurse's convictions re-examined

image.altText: Two men in ceremonial robes chat to each other

props.synopsis: After a year in which the royal family endured illness, conspiracy theories and embarrassing financial revelations, the last thing King Charles needed was a December surprise. But a scandal involving Prince Andrew and a foreign spy suggests the Windsors will not be able to leave the drama behind in 2025.

title.children: King Charles wanted a fresh start, but the year ended in a new scandal

image.altText: A worker surrounded by amazon packages scans them in a warehouse

props.synopsis: A US Senate investigation finds "shockingly" high levels of debilitating injuries and safety conditions made impossible to follow.

title.children: 'Blood, sweat and tears' fuelling Amazon's speed 'obsession', says new report

image.altText: Two men smiling on a red backdrop of a city skyline

props.synopsis: Never before in Australia has a state government had so much political power with so much wealth at its disposal. What does Labor have to show for its total control?

title.children: Here's what Australiaâs richest state government did with four years of dominance

image.altText: A blue screen with green and red stocks at the Australian Securities Exchange 29.8.21

props.synopsis: The ASX opens higher, looking to end a five-session losing streak. Wall Street resumes its rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Nasdaq, bitcoin hit fresh records, ASX edges higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Consumer watchdog sinks its fangs into Mobil
ASX 200 gains 0.8%, as banks rise and energy stocks fall
ACCC set to pursue retailers for misleading Black Friday promotions

image.altText: A man in a blue suit and black hair holds a microphone

props.synopsis: Chrystia Freeland, who is also finance minister, left cabinet on Monday after clashing with Mr Trudeau on issues including how to handle possible Trump tariffs.

title.children: Trudeau faces leadership test as deputy PM resigns over tariffs spat

image.altText: Photo of a machine spreading human waste.

props.synopsis: A Sydney Water document reveals sewage by-products used in food production contain elevated levels of PFAS.

title.children: Sewage by-products used on farms contaminated with 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: A young woman smiles. She wears headphones around her neck.

props.synopsis: Vanessa Mbeve spent more than a decade hiding away from the world, unhappy with the way cerebral palsy affected her. Now, at 26, she's breaking free from self-imposed shackles.

title.children: I no longer worry about what others think of me. Here's what changed

image.altText: Harry and Meghan wearing sunglasses and smiling and clapping while standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: Five new shows to watch this holiday season, from Harry and Meghan's attempt to make polo happen to Lisa Kudrow and Ray Romano as a married couple in their new dark comedy/mystery No Good Deed.

title.children: Harry and Meghan's Polo will fill the Drive-to-Survive-sized hole in your heart

image.altText: Woman stands with microphones in front of her

props.synopsis: Ann-Maree Greaney has been appointed Townsville's acting mayor a month after Troy Thompson, who is being investigated by the Crime and Corruption Commission, was suspended from his position on full pay.

title.children: Townsville gets third mayor in a month after 'tumultuous' leadership saga

image.altText: A photo of Roger Hearn in Gaza standing outside a building with blue arabic writing.

props.synopsis: As director of relief, Roger Hearn was responsible for organising the distribution of food from aid trucks coming in through the border. But what depressed him the most was being unable to bring in enough food to help feed Gaza's 1.9 million internally displaced people.

title.children: Australian aid worker has been to Gaza often, but this visit shook him

image.altText: cartoon picture of sailor reaching for a can of spinach

props.synopsis: Popeye and Tintin are among the iconic works to enter the public domain in the US from next year.

title.children: Popeye and Tintin enter the public domain in 2025
